intro: Blakea repens, commonly known as the creeping blakea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and small, palmate leaves. The plant produces clusters of showy, yellowish-white flowers that bloom throughout the wet season. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
